metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6488 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in downloads in Google Chrome prior to 83.0.4103.61 allowed a remote attacker to bypass navigation restrictions via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6488` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 83.0.4103.61-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 83.0.4103.61-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 83.0.4103.61-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 83.0.4103.61-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 83.0.4103.61-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0.4103.61-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
